column4: anyone have a working printer hooked to ubuntu that windows machines can print to?  i really could use some help
usp
usb

across the network
<_nathan> i agree, but ive spent 16 hours so far
ive been using linux for 8 years, never had this much of a problem
you are having a printing problem?
what happens?
no errors?   what does lpstat show?
you are trying to print from windows?
I would sniff the packets, see whether the print request gets to the linux box.  then you'll know which side to troubleshoot.
sounds like a samba issue, off hand
well, if you read for 1 hour, and you don't find it, the other 15 hours are wasted
capture the packets when you try to print.  then you'll have some data to work with.  when you have a problem and you don't know what to do about it, collect more data.
you have to be root, and you have to run the browser as root
so do  sudo firefox, then do   http://127.0.0.1:631
